title: Leicester City boost silverware hopes with victory over Burton Albion
text:
Burton Albion 1 Leicester City 3

It is over four years since Brendan Rodgers last suffered defeat in a domestic cup tie and Leicester’s season continues to gather momentum at rapid speed.

Since Liverpool’s FA Cup semi-final defeat by Aston Villa in April 2015, Rodgers has won 28 knockout games in a row and while this performance never reached the heights of their annihilation of Southampton, Leicester are into the last eight and growing in confidence.

They had appeared on course to run away with it after a devastating performance in the opening half-hour, but Nigel Clough’s League One club responded to produce another absorbing encounter at the Pirelli Stadium.

Burton have already embarrassed Premier League opposition here and Leicester required substitute James Maddison to provide the crucial third goal a minute from time and secure their path into the quarter-finals.

Yet Rodgers’s record in cup competitions, including that clean sweep during his time at Celtic, offers Leicester genuine hope of another memorable season.
